#Text=Psychiatrist Dr. Jerald Block tells Wikinews about addiction to the Internet
#Text=Wednesday , October 22 , 2008
#Text=Dr. Jerald Block is a psychiatrist based in Portland , Oregon , United States .
#Text=Dr. Block has attracted some media attention due to one theory of his - the idea that Internet addiction can be viewed as a distinct mental condition .
#Text=In an interview with Wikinews , Dr. Block discusses this theory , including what needs to be done about it , and the alleged violent response that can arise from an addict 's withdrawal .
#Text=Below is the full exclusive interview .
#Text=Interview
#Text=When and how did you first come up with the idea that it is possible to become addicted to the Internet ?
#Text=I have been working in this area since 1993 .
#Text=Earlier , really .
#Text=I was initially trained as an Industrial Engineer before becoming a MD .
#Text=I remember reading and writing about the impact of technology on people for an ergonomics class in college , way back in 1985 .
#Text=Even then , I found the topic fascinating .
#Text=Do you have any ideas for how Internet addiction could be treated ?
#Text=Harshly vs. gently .
#Text=The hardball approach is to punish for excessive use and restrict/limit access .
#Text=Perhaps send the individual to a computer-free outdoor camp for several weeks .
#Text=Some practitioners do this and think highly of the method .

#Text=My concern with it is ( 1 ) it generates tremendous anger ; ( 2 ) there is a high relapse rate , since the restriction is to something enormously common in society , enjoyable , and the limits are imposed rather than self-endorsed ; ( 3 ) what behavior will take the place of the computer ?
#Text=Is it any better ?
#Text=The gentle approach is to talk about the issue , come to some agreement about whether it truly is a problem , and then try to negotiate some sort of mutually-agreed on treatment plan .

#Text=This method also has its difficulties : it is time consuming , expensive , and does not guarantee the target behavior , the computer use , will ever be adequately addressed ( at least from society 's viewpoint ) .
#Text=Finally , both these methods can be helped along with the conservative use of meds , all of which would be " off-label " and targeted at OCD /Depressive sxs .
#Text=Activities such as gaming and viewing pornography predate the Internet , as does the potential to be addicted to them .
#Text=What is different about it when it is online ?
#Text=Well , with regards to porn , there are the three As -- Anonymous , Affordable , and Accessible .
#Text=One has the illusion of anonymity so , when looking at porn or researching one 's own paraphilia , individuals may no longer feel the shame that they might have in the past .
#Text=And , the porn is cheap and readily available .
#Text=With gaming , I 'd modify the list somewhat but it remains mostly true .

#Text=I 'd also add that games ( and porn , sometimes ) provide an effective outlet for aggression that is ( 1 ) time consuming , ( 2 ) socially acceptable , ( 3 ) entertaining , ( 4 ) empowering , and ( 5 ) engaging .
#Text=In moderation , the preoccupation can prevent people from acting on angry impulses .
#Text=However , over time , it may exacerbate such issues and make things worse .
